definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
to deal in/to buy and sell/to trade in/to retail/to peddle

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: He bought the ticket at a high price from a (ticket) scalper.
sentences.chinese: 他从一个票贩子手里高价买了张黄牛票。

sentences.english: We are able to get ticket to the “AndyLau” concert from a scalper outside the stadium.
sentences.chinese: 我们在体育场外从票贩子手里买了华仔演唱会的票。

sentences.english: We were plagued by ticket sharks at the entrance to the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 我们在剧院门口被票贩子缠住了。

sentences.english: We are able to get ticket to the "AndyLau" concert from a scalper outside the stadium.
sentences.chinese: 在体育场外从票贩子手里买了华仔演唱会的票。

sentences.english: Vote on the traffickers , the masses have a lot of wisdom to offer advice and suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 就票贩子的情况，群众也有无穷的智慧来献计献策。

sentences.english: A scalper sold us tickets for seats right at near the courtside.
sentences.chinese: 一个票贩子卖给我们的票正好靠近球场的边缘。

definition: ox/cattle/scalper of tickets etc/to fail to show up/to break a promise
hospital scalper/sb who for a profit entices others to obtain medical care
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
unlicensed or unofficial taxi/unlicensed motor vehicle
to bounce (a check)/to return a ticket/ticket refund
to solicit (guests, clients, passengers etc)/to importune
system for identifying users (on a rail network, the Internet etc)
